data.text: @Connecticutting Does he have any underlying conditions? Does the vaccine prevent the spread?
@JB21218795 My husband is a firefighter. A huge number of the medical calls he goes on are for Covid.
@Connecticutting I have no idea what you mean. Thats a selfie I took last week.

@dr_danbury Exactly. If by the Shining reference you mean he’s been alternating between crowing about vaccination and complaining his arm is a bit sore. What is a husband’s life if it isn’t built around mild psychological needling of his wife?

@Rev_Beaker Update: his arm is quite sore. This complaint has taken the place of reminding me he has been vaccinated. Said it feels pretty much like the flu shot, maybe a hair more uncomfortable. 
On a related note: his favorite hobby is complaining about non-complaints.
@Connecticutting https://t.co/aupvJLJfrk
@Connecticutting That's where they implant the 5G tracking chip 😂
@Connecticutting I only work with 400 people at FedEx. We'll wait patiently while those at low risk of dying go first.
@Connecticutting I can confirm it gives you a sore arm. And that's pretty high on the male pain index. So I completely empathize.
@StephenSamela No, but he did whine dramatically when he leaned against the doorway when he came into my office to tell me he was vaccinated for the 99th time today.
@Connecticutting Did he turn into an alligator yet?
@Incognegro_Ant @Connecticutting I had a month to month, but I was in that month to month lease for 6 1/2 years.
@brendanmahoney @Connecticutting I know of people who went as far as to sign a 3 month lease to secure a Hartford address when applying.
@Connecticutting When I applied way back when, at the exam people kept trying to explain why their IDs and applications had different addresses on them.
@Connecticutting Terrific news!!!
@brendanmahoney This does not shock me, unfortunately.
@Connecticutting Many, many fake addresses in Hartford on those applications (and I could totally use my mother in law's address), but I'm not that kind of person.
@brendanmahoney Fair. Very fair. NH doesn’t have residency requirements (though it does help if do live within the city).
@Connecticutting I'd have to move back to the city to be eligible, which is not like a bad thing, but selling my house and moving away for something that's not a sure bet is maybe slightly daft.
@Rev_Beaker I believe he would, as he’s been walking around since he got back telling me every five minutes that he’s been vaccinated
@brendanmahoney It’s never too late. My husband was an engineer before. Joined NHFD at 32...
@Connecticutting Once again, I am regretting my decision to go to law school instead of becoming a Hartford firefighter.

@brendanmahoney Hahaha I see what you did there.

He’s a firefighter.
@Connecticutting Is he a senator?
